answers.answer: Hi,Sorry to know about your father and I sympathise with you as you seem to be the caretaker. Diseases of the nervous system are an equal problem and burden to the caretakers as to the patient.Age brings with it changes in the nervous system, which lead to some of the problems that you have explained. These issues are exaggerated and increased due to alcohol abuse. Cerebellar damage due to alcohol is a cause of the balance disturbances that your father has.  The major causes of peripheral neuropathy are diabetes mellitus, Vitamin B deficiencies, specially B12, Hypothyroidism, alcoholism, rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, kidney and liver diseases.You may correct me if I am wrong, but your letter makes me feel that your father continues to use alcohol. If that is so, then there is no validity of the statement that he is willing to go to any distance to find a cure. If he is unable to stop alcohol, then there is no use of going any distance at all.You might try to consult a psychiatrist who may suggest some therapy for alcoholism and also may give some medicines which may solve any component of accompanying depression that such patients have. This will improve the quality of his mental life, at least, at this age.Regards

question: I need help.  My 75 year old father has been diagnoised with ataxic gait, intermittent left facial twitching, spasticity in both legs, a positive Hoffman's sign on left side.  Numbness in fingers on both hands, memory loss, tingling sensation in both feet.  As well as a bone spur in neck pressing on spinal cord, brain shrinkage, hardened areas of the frontal lobe, and damage to cortex area of brain..  He has previously had 2 back surgeries for disc degeneration resulting in a titanium rod inserted in lower back. The Neurogolist advised all of the above is due to many years of alcohol use and there is nothing that can be done to improve his quality of life except giving up alcohol which might stop diseas from progressing. Is there anything that can be done for his hands, his balance and memory.  He is willing to go anywhere and undergo any procedure to gain the use of his hands and walk better.  We can live with the memory loss.  I need help please.
title: NEUROPATHY IN 75 YEAR OLD MALE
